conclusion: Length of conductor rod ab is 4L, uniform magnetic field with induction intensity B, rod rotates at constant angular velocity ω around axis through point O, distance between a and O is negligibly small, rod rotates in a plane perpendicular to the magnetic field
The rod rotates in a magnetic field, which will induce an EMF due to the motion of charges in the conductor through the magnetic field
The potential difference U_ab will be determined by the induced EMF
Use Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction: ε = ∫(v × B) · dl
v is the velocity of each point on the conductor, B is the magnetic field, dl is an infinitesimal length element along the conductor
Since point a is very close to O, consider the rod as rotating with one end (a) at the axis of rotation
For a point at distance r from O, the tangential velocity is v = ωr
For an infinitesimal segment dr at position r from O, contribution to EMF is dU = B · ωr · dr
Integrating from r = 0 (point a) to r = 4L (point b), U_ab = ∫_0^4L B · ωr · dr
